parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Women, Children and People with Disabilities
questionto: Minister of Women, Children and People with Disabilities

speeches.intro: 510. Mrs B L Abrahams (DA-Gauteng) to ask the Minister of Women, Children and People with Disabilities:
speeches.text: (a) How many persons with disabilities are (i) Members of Parliament (MPs) and (ii) currently employed by Parliament and (b) what is the category level in each case?

title: CW640E - 14 September 2012

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Women, Children and People with Disabilities
questionto: Minister of Women, Children and People with Disabilities

speeches.intro: 511. Mrs B L Abrahams (DA-Gauteng) to ask the Minister of Women, Children and People with Disabilities:
speeches.text: Whether any waiting list exists for houses for persons with disabilities; if not, what is the position in this regard; if so, (a) how many persons are on the waiting list in each province, (b) what is the anticipated period that each person has to wait in order to be allocated a house and (c) what are the further relevant details?

title: CW641E - 14 September 2012

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Human Settlements

speeches.intro: 515. Mrs B L Abrahams (DA-Gauteng) to ask the Minister of Human Settlements:
speeches.text: (a) What are the reasons for hostels that have been built and developed into family units not being occupied on completion, (b) how many (i) new hostel units were developed and (ii) hostel units have been (aa) upgraded and (bb) developed into family units since 1 April 2009, (c) who will be the beneficiaries of these hostels in each case and (d) when will these hostels be occupied?

title: CW645E - 14 September 2012

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Women, Children and People with Disabilities
questionto: Minister of Women, Children and People with Disabilities

speeches.intro: 495. Mr D A Worth (DA-FS) to ask the Minister of Women, Children and People with Disabilities:
speeches.text: (1) Whether, in light of August being celebrated as Women’s Month and the high incidents of rape and violence against women and children, the (a) Domestic Violence Act, Act 116 of 1998, and (b) Criminal Law Amendment Act, Act 105 of 1997, have been implemented effectively; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details; (2) whether the lives of (a) women and (b) children have been uplifted by providing them with (i) better education and (ii) access to health care; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details?

title: CW603E - 14 September 2012

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Public Enterprises

speeches.intro: 496. Mr D A Worth (DA-FS) to ask the Minister of Public Enterprises:
speeches.text: (1) (a) When is it anticipated that the rail-corridor between South Africa and the Democratic Republic of Congo will be completed and (b) how will the corridor facilitate trade between the Southern African Development Community (SADC); (2) whether the SADC countries will financially benefit from this rail-corridor; if not, why not; if so, how?

title: CW606E - 14 September 2012

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Human Settlements

speeches.intro: 512. Mr D A Worth (DA-FS) to ask the Minister of Human Settlements:
speeches.text: (1) Whether he intends to place the provincial department of Cooperative Governance, Housing and Traditional Affairs in the Free State under administration as a result of unauthorised expenditure; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details; (2) whether any investigations will be conducted to ascertain how these funds were spent; if not, why not; if so, (a) what will be the scope of the investigation, (b) when will the investigation (i) commence and (ii) be completed and (c) what are the further relevant details; (3) whether any charges will be brought against any officials who have been found guilty of misconduct; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details; (4) what steps will be taken to (a) prevent and (b) detect such expenditure?

title: CW642E - 14 September 2012

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Correctional Services

speeches.intro: 501. Mr D V Bloem (COPE-FS) to ask the Minister of Correctional Services:
speeches.text: (1) (a) How many court cases relating to parole issues has his department (i) won in the (aa) 2008-09, (bb) 2009-10 and (c) 2010-11 financial years and (ii) lost and (b) how many of these cases resulted in financial implications for the Government; (2) (a) how many of these cases are (i) labour-related and (ii) parole issues and (b) how many of these cases are currently before the court and (c) what is the duration thereof; (3) whether the legal advice received in respect of the various cases in which his department is a litigant has been found to be correct; if not, what is the position in this regard; if so, what are the relevant details?

title: CW630E - 14 September 2012

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Trade and Industry

speeches.intro: 499. Mr F Adams (ANC-WC) to ask the Minister of Trade and Industry:
speeches.text: (1) Whether the Government has taken a policy position requiring Israeli goods from Jewish settlements in the West Bank to be labelled as originating from the occupied Palestinian territory; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details; (2) whether there have been any bilateral engagements between South Africa and Israel since this position was undertaken; if not, what is the position in this regard; if so, what are the relevant details; (3) what monitoring mechanisms are in place to (a) enforce and (b) monitor the implementation of South Africa’s position in this regard?

title: CW612E - 14 September 2012

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Communications

speeches.intro: 507. Mr H B Groenewald (DA-NW) to ask the Minister of Communications:
speeches.text: With reference to the proposal by the Government Communication and Information System (GCIS) that a certain percentage of the ad-spend be committed to a predetermined list of media, as defined by the Media Development and Diversity Agency, (a) how has the GCIS defined Community ad-spend, (b) what are the benefits to the industry, (c) how will the predetermined list be established and (d) what are the further relevant details?

title: CW637E - 14 September 2012

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Energy

speeches.intro: 508. Mr H B Groenewald (DA-NW) to ask the Minister of Energy:
speeches.text: Whether the project manager of the (a) Medupi and (b) Kasib Power Stations is registered in compliance with the regulations of the Project and Construction Management Professions Act, Act 48 of 2000; if not, what is the position in this regard; if so, what are the relevant details in respect of the registration documents in each case?

title: CW638E - 14 September 2012

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Communications

speeches.intro: 509. Mr H B Groenewald (DA-NW) to ask the Minister of Communications:
speeches.text: Whether any progress has been made with regard to the report to be compiled by the Media Development and Diversity Agency (MDDA) on the state of ad-spend by the (a) public and (ii) private sector; if not, what is the position in this regard; if so, what are the relevant details?

title: CW639E - 14 September 2012

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Public Enterprises

speeches.intro: 497. Mr K A Sinclair (COPE-NC) to ask the Minister of Public Enterprises:
speeches.text: Whether, with reference to a lecture he delivered at the China Executive Leadership Academy in Shanghai on 28 September 2011 (details furnished), he will provide details regarding (a) the role that the state-owned enterprises (SOEs) of South Africa will play in the economic development of Africa, (b) specific progress that has been achieved between the SOEs of South Africa and China and (c) the impact that the interaction between SOEs of South Africa and China will have on the economy and infrastructure needs of (i) Africa in general and (ii) South African in particular; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details?

title: CW608E - 14 September 2012

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Public Enterprises

speeches.intro: 502. Mr K A Sinclair (COPE-NC) to ask the Minister of Public Enterprises:
speeches.text: With reference to the legal action of the SA Airways against the former chief executive officer regarding the misspending of funds, (a) how much of these funds have been recovered and (b) what is the current status of litigation?

title: CW631E - 14 September 2012

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Economic Development

speeches.intro: 503. Mr K A Sinclair (COPE-NC) to ask the Minister of Economic Development:
speeches.text: With regard to the Green Economy drive, what progress has been made in terms of the New Growth Path in relation to the (a) number of jobs that have been created, (b) the sectors in which these jobs were created and (c) cost of each job opportunity that has been created?

title: CW632E - 14 September 2012

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Defence and Military Veterans
questionto: Minister of Defence and Military Veterans

speeches.intro: 500. Mr M J R de Villiers (DA-WC) to ask the Minister of Defence and Military Veterans:
speeches.text: (1) Whether any (a) private and/or (b) public South African entity has (i) supplied and/or (ii) sold any arms to the government of Rwanda (aa) during the past three financial years and (bb) from 1 April 2012 up to the latest specified date for which information is available; if not, what is the position in this regard; if so, (aaa) what was the total value of the sale for this period and (bbb) which arms; (2) whether these arms are being used for defence purposes only; if not, what is the position in this regard; if so, how was this conclusion reached?

title: CW615E - 14 September 2012

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Basic Education

speeches.intro: 513. Mr M J R de Villiers (DA-WC) to ask the Minister of Basic Education:
speeches.text: What (a) progress has been made with the Quintile 1 schools since the date of commencement, (b) challenges have been encountered so far in (i) schools and (ii) grades, (c) steps have been taken to remedy the challenges encountered, (d) recommendations have been made to rectify these challenges in each case, (e) are the names of each school that (i) was already included in the plan and (ii) he intends to include and (f) are the relevant grades in each case?

title: CW643E - 14 September 2012

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Health

speeches.intro: 514. Mr M J R de Villiers (DA-WC) to ask the Minister of Health:
speeches.text: (a) What are the names of each primary health care (PHC) facility which implemented the nutritional intervention for people living with (i) HIV/Aids and (ii) tuberculosis, (b) where is each facility situated, (c) how many patients in respect of each PHC facility are included in the intervention, (d) what is the (i) daily cost and (ii) total cost since the implementation date up to the latest specified date for which information is available to supply each patient with the nutritional supplements and (e) who is responsible for (i) monitoring and (ii) coordinating the progress of the plan?

title: CW644E - 14 September 2012

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Cooperative Governance and Traditional Affairs
questionto: Minister for Cooperative Governance and Traditional Affairs

speeches.intro: 516. Prince M M M Zulu (IFP-KZN) to ask the Minister for Cooperative Governance and Traditional Affairs:
speeches.text: Whether his department has implemented the programmes detailed by him when he was launching the R47 billion Strategic Integrated Project Number 7 (SIP 7) on 11 May 2012 as part of the 17 Presidential Infrastructure Coordinating Commission (PICC); if not, (a) why not and (b) when will these programmes be implemented; if so, what are the relevant details?

title: CW646E - 14 September 2012

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Rural Development and Land Reform
questionto: Minister of Rural Development and Land Reform

speeches.intro: 498. Mr O de Beer (COPE-WC) to ask the Minister of Rural Development and Land Reform:
speeches.text: Whether any evaluations and assessments of the Comprehensive Rural Development Plan (CRDP) to fight poverty have been made (a) in (i) 2010 and (ii) 2011 and (b) from 1 January 2012 up to the latest specified date for which information is available; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details?

title: CW609E - 14 September 2012

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Police

speeches.intro: 504. Mr O de Beer (COPE-WC) to ask the Minister of Police:
speeches.text: (1) Whether he has been informed of the staff shortages at the Malmesbury Police Station; if not, what is the position in this regard; if so, what are the relevant details; (2) what steps have been taken to (a) ensure proper staff compliment at the station and (b) make the police station more accessible to residents that are affected by crime in hotspot areas?

title: CW634E - 14 September 2012

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Health

speeches.intro: 505. Mr O de Beer (COPE-WC) to ask the Minister of Health:
speeches.text: Whether the Swartland Hospital is part of the Infrastructure Development Plan for hospital upgrades; if not, why not; if so, what are the relevant details?

title: CW635E - 14 September 2012

parent_section_titles: Questions
Questions asked to the Minister of Water and Environmental Affairs
questionto: Minister of Water and Environmental Affairs

speeches.intro: 506. Mr R A Lees (DA-KZN) to ask the Minister of Water and Environmental Affairs:
speeches.text: (1) Whether the required environmental approvals have been (a) applied for and (b) awarded for the cemetery which is under construction in the Bluebank Road on the outskirts of Ladysmith in KwaZulu-Natal; if not, what action has to be taken to ensure that the structures erected are demolished; if so, what are the relevant details; (2) what is the name of the municipality that has started the construction of the cemetery; (3) whether the site of the cemetery is part of a flood plain; if not, what is the position in this regard; if so, what are the relevant details?

title: CW636E - 14 September 2012
